page.title: 16INTERVIEW WITH FARMER (CONT)
page.content: The soil is mixed. Fields are bordered mainly by fences but dry-stane dyking is best. There is little or no woodland and the only water present on the farm is a burn which contains minnows. He feels he can make a contribution to preserve what is good in the countryside by looking after hedges. He is interested in the wildlife in his area and sees regularly rabbits, hare, deer pigeons, crows, pheasants and oyster catchers. Water comes from the main supply. Electricity is used for cooking. St. Andrews is the main town for shopping. All houses on his land have running water, electricity and inside toilets.The main disease in crops is mildew and the pest is leather jackets. Chemical spray is the treatment for both.
